snippet: Dan Halem, Major League Baseball’s chief legal officer and new drug czar, said that the league recognized the problem with stanozolol and for years had been trying to tackle it.
abstract: Juliet Macur Sports of The Times column analyzes surprising number of professional baseball players who have been suspended for using stanozolol, steroid that is easy to detect; observes that while drug was absent from major leagues for years, it is extremely prevalent in the minors, making it a tempting to choice for prospects under pressure; notes that new MLB drug czar Dan Halem says league has long been working on problem.
lead_paragraph: Dan Halem, Major League Baseball’s chief legal officer and new drug czar, said that the league recognized the problem with stanozolol and for years had been trying to tackle it.

headline.print_headline: Persistence of a Steroid Bedevils Baseball
